heading: Learning Paths
text:
I often get asked what courses to take and in what order to become a front-end, back-end, or a full-stack software engineer.

I've created some possible learning paths to help you decide what’s best for you. You can find them at:
https://codewithmosh.com/p/learning-paths

heading: 11- What to Learn Next
text:
What to Learn Next
Ok, I guess you’re all fired up to learn more right now - it’s exciting when you start discovering new things!
So, here's a short and sweet guideline on what to learn next. Also, as a valued student, I've got some awesome extra discounts for my other courses - as a thank you gift.
As you've just seen, we use Node for building back-ends. Now, you can learn about front-end development which is all about building the front of an application: in other words - what the user sees and interacts with. A developer who knows both front and back-end development is called a full-stack developer. Full-stack developers earn more because they have more skills and are more useful to employers.
The Ultimate Full-stack JavaScript Bundle
If you want to learn everything there is to know about front-end and back-end development, I seriously recommend you go ahead and enrol on my Ultimate Full-stack JavaScript Bundle.
This bundle has all my JavaScript courses for front-end and back-end development. Also, in this bundle you'll get any new related courses that I create - for free. Believe me, it's the ultimate way to learn and save money at the same time.
To enrol with extra discounts use the link below:
https://sso.teachable.com/secure/146684/checkout/992457/full-stack-javascript-developer-bundle?coupon_code=BAY39
Front-end Development
There are many different libraries and frameworks for building front-ends. React, Angular and Vue are the top three. Out of the three, React is the easiest to learn. So, I'd recommend you start there.
To get my complete React course with extra discounts, use this link:
https://sso.teachable.com/secure/146684/checkout/754264/mastering-react?coupon_code=BAY39
Once you learn React, if you want to increase your job opportunities, you can learn Angular and Vue. I don't currently have a course about Vue but I'm planning to create one soon.
To get my Angular course with extra discounts, use this link:
https://sso.teachable.com/secure/146684/checkout/947508/angular-master-class?coupon_code=BAY39
